subject: device-node: Fix build under 64-bit architecture
commitMessage:
device-node: Fix build under 64-bit architecture

- Ignore cast warnings

Change-Id: I5e9aa7b850370440c11e1c5ee3e58c381a1d71fc
Signed-off-by: Jiyoung Yun <jy910.yun@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

Isn't it possible to cast properly and avoid warnings?

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is not a proper fix IMO.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Please check the pending requests https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/#/c/31562/ that I made few time ago.

It is obviously more complicated and MUST not be solved by ignoring the warnings of the compiler.

Please check 
ttps://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/TC-2287 and reply there.

Patch Set 1:

I saw the issue and updated my comments on TC-2287. I know it's not a good way. Clearly current OAL module and libdevice-node do not consider about 64 bit archs and scalability. So I have a plan to proposal new OAL structure. But aside from this, libdevice-node should be merged to fix the crash of deviced. So I removed -Werror option temporarily. I want to manage this issue using TC-2287 instead of this patch. What about you ?

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

It would be better if the commit message has the reason why -Werror should be removed temporarily.

Patch Set 1:

What's wrong with José's patch? It's fixing the same issue.

Patch Set 1:

I don't think that Jose''s patch has an issue. We are fixing the same issue in other ways. I'm not sure if the -Werror option is really needed so I want to remove it. If we really need the -Werror option, we can use OBS global setting. What do you think about it ?

subject: Update the packaging to the current build context
commitMessage:
Update the packaging to the current build context

Previous version was accessing glib-2.0 through the
the requires directive of the pkgconfig of vconf.
Making that dependency explicit is better.

Also a problem of int to pointer cast was raising
an error when building for 64 bits archs.

Change-Id: I2078f2ab9c9f6a0c5f2a80c2cc3537c99b6c6951
Signed-off-by: José Bollo <jose.bollo@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

Did you see my comments?

Patch Set 1: Verified-1

(1 comment)

Thx Krysztof

Patch Set 1:

krzysztof, after search, this is a huge problem! I've opened https://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/TC-2287

 am asking me what to do now. Ideas?

Patch Set 1:

Actually I think current structure of OAL should be redesigned. As you know it does not consider about 64 bits archs so it passed the character pointer value to int by force typecasting. To fix it, many logic should be fixed together. So I have a plan to proposal new OAL module structure soon. In brief, if there is a common interface on kernel side, I think OAL module is not needed but in another case it should be needed a wrapper function to implement code in accordance with their kernel or device driver side. But it's just my idea so if you have any idea about OAL module, please let me know. Thank you.

subject: device-node: Add null check operation of interface function
commitMessage:
device-node: Add null check operation of interface function

If there is no interface for something to do,
it will return -ENOTSUP error instead of segfault.

Signed-off-by: Jiyoung Yun <jy910.yun@samsung.com>
Change-Id: If9dfdaecf53c88e14879dc66986e12cdcd1c2355

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Currently deviced occurs crash in nuc board (ia32-wayland) because of null pointer access.
IVI profile including ia32 do not have an oem interface library that is a kind of HAL.
So if there is no interface library, it uses default library and also checks a null pointer access.

Patch Set 3: Verified+1

I changed ENODEV to ENOTSUP.
